channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bloody river battle was third in three days - Ukraine official
item.description: Ukraine claims to have attacked Russian troops as they attempted to cross the Siversky Donets river.

item.title: Ukraine begins first war crimes trial of Russian soldier
item.description: In the first such trial of the war, the defendant, 21, is accused of killing an unarmed civilian.

item.title: Shireen Abu Aqla: Violence at Al Jazeera reporter's funeral in Jerusalem
item.description: Police with riot gear hit mourners, saying they were pelted with stones, as crowds carry her coffin.

item.title: Sri Lanka economy crisis to get worse before it gets better, PM says
item.description: Sri Lanka's new PM tells the BBC the country's dire economic crisis will get worse before it gets better.

item.title: Kenyan fighting FGM crowned world's best nurse
item.description: Anna Qabale Duba says the $250,000 prize money will help expand her school for children and adults.

item.title: North Korea announces first death from Covid-19
item.description: A day after confirming its first cases, state media reports thousands are suffering fever symptoms.

item.title: Elon Musk puts Twitter deal on hold over fake account details
item.description: The billionaire wants more data on fake accounts, prompting speculation over the deal's future.

item.title: Eleven migrants drown trying to reach US territory
item.description: Almost 40 people, mostly from Haiti, were rescued after their boat capsized near Puerto Rico.

item.title: Brittney Griner: US basketball star has Russian detention extended
item.description: Russian media says Moscow wishes to "swap" Griner for the arms trafficker Viktor Bout.

item.title: Ukraine war: UK adds Putin's former wife to sanctions list
item.description: Both Vladimir Putin's former wife and his alleged current girlfriend are sanctioned over the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Rwandan genocide fugitive Protais Mpiranya confirmed dead
item.description: Protais Mpiranya led the presidential guard that killed the then-PM and 10 Belgian peacekeepers.

item.title: Ukraine conflict: Russian soldiers seen killing unarmed civilians
item.description: The incident, captured on video seen by the BBC, is being investigated as a suspected war crime.

item.title: Sri Lanka crisis: How war heroes became villains
item.description: The Rajapaksa brothers, hailed by many as heroes for winning the civil war, are now reviled as leaders.

item.title: Afghanistan pupils in fear after spate of Islamic State attacks
item.description: A spate of Islamic State attacks have left Afghan students in fear and test Taliban security claims.

item.title: Eurovision 2022: The anthem for Ukraine born in a war zone
item.description: The BBC joined Ukraine's Kalush Orchestra as they prepared for the contest amid the rubble of the city of Irpin.

item.title: LPG price: Millions hit hard as cooking gas cost soars in India
item.description: Many households in rural areas are forced to rely on wood for cooking as gas has become unaffordable.

item.title: Ukraine crisis: Could India cut its defence ties with Russia?
item.description: India has been under pressure to distance itself from Russia over Ukraine, including reducing defence ties.

item.title: The long struggle to return Cambodia's looted treasures
item.description: The east Asian country claims the V&A and British Museum both hold stolen antiquities.

item.title: Clashes at Al Jazeera journalist's funeral procession
item.description: Violent scenes between police, and mourners of killed reporter Shireen Abu Aqla.

item.title: The Ukrainian refugee schoolgirl learning fast in the UK
item.description: Ukrainian refugee Marharyta, nine, is learning English as she waits to start school in Manchester.

item.title: Ukraine: The BBC has seen evidence of possible war crimes committed by Russian soldiers
item.description: The BBC has obtained CCTV footage of the killing of two civilians in cold blood by Russian soldiers that is now being investigated by prosecutors as a suspected war crime.

item.title: We're ready to consider Nato membership - Finland's foreign minister
item.description: Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto tells the BBC that that he wants Finland to join Nato as soon as possible.

item.title: Air traffic controller on helping passenger land plane after pilot fell ill
item.description: Robert Morgan talked passenger Darren Harrison through landing a plane after the pilot fell ill.

item.title: Joly Germine: Haitian gang leader indicted over missionary abductions
item.description: Joly Germine allegedly directed the kidnappings of 17 Christian missionaries from a Haitian prison.
